start.speaker: Mirka
start.text:
Stone holds because it is honest. Mortar holds because it keeps its promise.

Tell me what you will keep, when keeping it costs you.

choices.text: I’ll keep the promise to repair—no matter who benefits.
I’ll keep the promise to people first—walls second.

end.speaker: Narrator
end.text: Mirka nods once. The gesture is small, but it sets like mortar: slow, binding, real.
